Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

Their response: it sucks.

My response: Oh no, tell me about it.

Other people in line: gtfo of the line
When customers asks me how my day is going I am never honest because I’d rather not be there dealing with annoying customers. But I’m told that’s not good customer service.
Terrible advice, you're just another table. I'll alwaye be courteous and attentive but beyond that, it's a job.

I would hate that. Why did so many people think that people in service want to have a conversation. I spent years in over phone pc tech support and the most uncomfortable thing is when a cx would try to have a non work relayed conversation with me.

The kindest thing you can do for a food service worker is to be quick, clear and concise with your order. If there's any sort of line, if it's busy AT ALL, or if it's anywhere near opening or closing time, do not do this. 

They're busy, likely understaffed and overworked, they don't have time to make small talk with you.
